me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api

Interface STBItem

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    STBBlock
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIOMachine, AbstractProcessingMachine, AdvancedMoistureChecker, AdvancedRecipeBook, AdvancedSenderModule, AngelicBlock, BagOfHolding, BaseSTBBlock, BaseSTBItem, BaseSTBMachine, BasicSolarCell, BatteryBox, BigStorageUnit, BlankModule, BlockUpdateDetector, BreakerModule, CircuitBoard, CombineHoe, DiamondCombineHoe, DirectionalItemRouterModule, DistributorModule, DropperModule, EjectorUpgrade, Elevator, EnderBag, EnderBox, EnderLeash, EnderTuner, EnergyCell, FiftyKBatteryBox, FiftyKEnergyCell, Floodlight, Generator, GoldCombineHoe, GoldDust, HeatEngine, HyperStorageUnit, IronCombineHoe, IronDust, ItemRouter, ItemRouterModule, MachineFrame, MachineUpgrade, Masher, MoistureChecker, MultiBuilder, Multimeter, PaintBrush, PaintCan, PaintRoller, PullerModule, Pump, ReceiverModule, RecipeBook, RedstoneClock, RegulatorUpgrade, Sawmill, SenderModule, SimpleCircuit, Smelter, SorterModule, SoundMuffler, SpeedModule, SpeedUpgrade, StackModule, TapeMeasure, TenKEnergyCell, TrashCan, VacuumModule, WateringCan, WoodCombineHoe

    public interface STBItem

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<? extends STBItem> getCraftingRestriction(Material mat)
      Given a material name, return the type of STB item that crafting ingredients of this type must be to count as a valid crafting ingredient for this item.
      String getDisplaySuffix()
      Get any suffix to be appended to the item's displayed name.
      String[] getExtraLore()
      Get extra lore to be appended to the base lore.
      Recipe[] getExtraRecipes()
      Get any alternative vanilla crafting recipes used to create the item.
      String getItemName()
      Get the item's displayed name.
      String getItemTypeID()
      Get the short type identifier code for this item.
      String[] getLore()
      Get the base lore to display for the item.
      Material getMaterial()
      Get the material used to represent this item.
      MaterialData getMaterialData()
      Get the material and data used to represent this item.
      Recipe getRecipe()
      Get the vanilla crafting recipe used to create the item.
      ItemStack getSmeltingResult()
      Get the item into which this item would be smelted.
      boolean hasGlow()
      Check if the item should glow.
      boolean isEnchantable()
      Check if this item can be enchanted normally in an enchanting table.
      boolean isIngredientFor(ItemStack result)
      Check if this item is used as an ingredient for the given resulting item.
      boolean isWearable()
      Check if this item is wearable.
      ItemStack toItemStack()
      Get an ItemStack with one item from this STB item, serializing any item-specific data into the ItemStack.
      ItemStack toItemStack(int amount)
      Get an ItemStack from this STB item, serializing any item-specific data into the ItemStack.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaterialData

        MaterialData getMaterialData()
        Get the material and data used to represent this item.
        Returns:
        the material data

      • getMaterial

        Material getMaterial()
        Get the material used to represent this item.
        Returns:
        the material

      • getItemName

        String getItemName()
        Get the item's displayed name.
        Returns:
        the item name

      • getDisplaySuffix

        String getDisplaySuffix()
        Get any suffix to be appended to the item's displayed name. Override this in implementing classes where you wish to represent some or all of the item's state in the display name.
        Returns:
        the display suffix

      • getLore

        String[] getLore()
        Get the base lore to display for the item.
        Returns:
        the item lore

      • getExtraLore

        String[] getExtraLore()
        Get extra lore to be appended to the base lore. Override this in implementing classes where you wish to represent some or all of the item's state in the item lore.
        Returns:
        the extra item lore

      • getRecipe

        Recipe getRecipe()
        Get the vanilla crafting recipe used to create the item.
        Returns:
        the recipe, or null if the item does not have a vanilla crafting recipe

      • getExtraRecipes

        Recipe[] getExtraRecipes()
        Get any alternative vanilla crafting recipes used to create the item.
        Returns:
        an array of recipes

      • getCraftingRestriction

        Class<? extends STBItem> getCraftingRestriction(Material mat)
        Given a material name, return the type of STB item that crafting ingredients of this type must be to count as a valid crafting ingredient for this item.
        Parameters:
        mat - the ingredient material
        Returns:
        null for no restriction, or a BaseSTBItem subclass to specify a restriction

      • isIngredientFor

        boolean isIngredientFor(ItemStack result)
        Check if this item is used as an ingredient for the given resulting item.
        Parameters:
        result - the resulting item
        Returns:
        true if this item may be used, false otherwise

      • hasGlow

        boolean hasGlow()
        Check if the item should glow. This will only work if ProtocolLib is installed.
        Returns:
        true if the item should glow

      • getSmeltingResult

        ItemStack getSmeltingResult()
        Get the item into which this item would be smelted.
        Returns:
        the resulting itemstack, or null if this object does not smelt

      • isEnchantable

        boolean isEnchantable()
        Check if this item can be enchanted normally in an enchanting table.
        Returns:
        true if the item can be enchanted

      • toItemStack

        ItemStack toItemStack()
        Get an ItemStack with one item from this STB item, serializing any item-specific data into the ItemStack.
        Returns:
        the new ItemStack

      • toItemStack

        ItemStack toItemStack(int amount)
        Get an ItemStack from this STB item, serializing any item-specific data into the ItemStack.
        Parameters:
        amount - number of items in the stack
        Returns:
        the new ItemStack

      • getItemTypeID

        String getItemTypeID()
        Get the short type identifier code for this item.
        Returns:
        the item's type ID

      • isWearable

        boolean isWearable()
        Check if this item is wearable. By default, any armour item will be wearable, but if you wish to use an armour material for a non-wearable item, then override this method.
        Returns:
        true if the item is wearable
